content.question: Assume that the firms in an industry pollute a river. If there is no government intervention, the firms will

choices.label: produce more output than is socially efficient
pay production costs that are higher than actual social costs
charge a lower price than is necessary to maximize profit
charge a higher price to pay for the pollution
increase production to achieve allocative efficiency

content.answer: produce more output than is socially efficient

unit.text: 6: Market Failure and the Role of Government

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine the outcome of an economic situation using economic concepts, principles, or models.
